results.title: Rose
results.description: A rose is a woody perennial flowering plant of the genus Rosa, in the family Rosaceae, or the flower it bears.

results.title: Lily
results.description: The lily is a genus of flowering plant. There are many species of lilies, like trumpet lilies and tiger lilies.

results.title: Lotus
results.description: The Lotus (Nelumbo nucifera) symbolizes purity, beauty, majesty, grace, fertility, wealth, richness, knowledge and serenity.

results.title: Jasmine
results.description: The Jasmine is native to tropical and warm or temperate regions of the old world. The Jasmine flowers are white in most species, with some species being yellow.

results.title: Lavender
results.description: Lavandula (common name lavender) is a genus of 47 known species of flowering plants in the mint family, Lamiaceae.

results.title: Orchid
results.description: The Orchidaceae are a diverse and widespread family of flowering plants, with blooms that are often colourful and fragrant, commonly known as the orchid family.

results.title: Pansy
results.description: The garden pansy is a type of large-flowered hybrid plant cultivated as a garden flower.

results.title: Sunflower
results.description: The sunflower (Helianthus annuus) is a living annual plant in the family Asteraceae, with a large flower head (capitulum).

results.title: Tulip
results.description: Tulipa (tulips) is a genus of spring-blooming perennial herbaceous bulbiferous geophytes, dying back after flowering to an underground storage bulb.

results.title: Protea
results.description: Protea cynaroides, the king protea, is a flowering plant. It is a distinctive member of Protea, having the largest flower head in the genus.
